description.en: The course presents fundamentals of metrology: principles of the SI (International System of Units), unit definitions and realisation of 4 SI base units, traceability of measurement results and calibration of the measuring instruments, categories of metrology: scientific, industrial and legal metrology, principles and methods of the precise measurements, estimation of uncertainty in measurement.
description.et: Kursusel osaleja saab ülevaate rahvusvahelise mõõtühikute süsteemi SI tänapäevasest ülesehitusest, toimimisest ning mõõtühikute praktilisest realiseerimisest. Käsitletakse SI-süsteemi nelja põhisuuruse mõõtühiku esitamise tehnilisi aspekte ning tulevikusuundumusi.

objectives.en: The purpose of the course is to give fundamental knowledge on measurements, measurement units (in particular the SI system of measurement units) measurement infrastructure as a working system and to give practical knowledge with generic aspects of measurements and interpretation of measurement results.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärgiks on anda teadmised mõõtmiste korraldusest ning toimivast süsteemist ning aidata kursuse läbinul orienteeruda edasises praktilises töös, kus mõõtmised, mõõtetulemused ning nende interpreteerimine on olulised. Kursus annab ülevaate ülemaailmselt tunnustatud mõõtühikute süsteemi kujunemisest, organiseeritusest ja praktilisest toimimisest.

learning_outcomes.et: Tudengil on süsteemne arusaamine ülemaailmse mõõtesüsteemi kujunemisest, organiseeritusest ja praktilisest toimimisest

independent_work.et: Three home works, which are given at lectures. The home works are focused on problem solving.

description.et: The examination consists of one uncertainty estimation problem (30 points), three longer questions about different topics including quantities and units, measurement standards, uncertainty in measurement, metrology infrastructure, traceability (30 points) and ten short questions about facts (20 points). The time limit is 4 hours.
A short seminare presentation on a topic chosen from a list (20 points). The time limit is 7 minutes for presentation and 5 minutes for questions and feedback.

grade_preconditions.et: Three hometasks have to be accepted by supervisors in order to be allowed to write the examination work. The hometasks have to be submitted within 3 weeks. No points from homework will be added to the final score of the examination.

grade_evaluation.et: The final score is formed by written examination (80 points) and short seminare presentation (20 points). The sum of scores is converted to the mark using the classical scheme: 51-60 E, 61-70 D, 71-80 C, 81-90 B and 91-100 A. If the result falls exactly on the borderline then the higher mark is used.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
1. The Metre Convention, CIPM Mutual Recognition Arrangement, www.bipm.org
2. International vocabulary of metrology - Basic and general concepts and associated terms (VIM), JCGM 2012, www.bipm.org
3. The International System of Units (SI), Bureau International des Poids et Mesures, 8th edition, 2006, www.bipm.org
4. JCGM 100:2008 Evaluation of measurement data - Guide to the expression of uncertainty in measurement. JCGM, 2008. Available on-line from http://www.bipm.org/en/publications/guides/gum.html
resources.recommended_materials: Alexius J. Hebra, The Physics of Metrology - All about Instruments: From Trundle Wheels to Atomic Clocks, Springer 2010

description.et: Introduction. About the arrangement of the course. Metrology infrastructure. The concept of metrology, The Metre Convention, CGPM, CIPM, BIPM, National metrology institutes, Regional metrology organizations, EURAMET, Metrology infrastructure in Estonia
Traceability of measurement results and impact of metrology. Traceability, Calibration. Impact of metrology.

The SI system of units in general. Concepts, Measurement equations, Base quantities and units, Derived quantities and units,The international system of units (SI), definitions of SI base units, SI base units and fundamental constants, SI writing rules.

Base quantities of SI - mass. Concepts related to mass, Conventional mass, The SI unit of mass, Realization of the mass scale, Weights and balances, Weighing techniques Significant influence quantities, Watt balance, International Avogadro Project.

Base quantities of SI - Thermodynamic temperature. History of temperature measurement, Empirical temperature scales, Thermodynamic temperature scale, Definition of the unit of thermodynamic temperature, ITS-90, Primary thermometers, Secondary thermometers.
Base quantities of SI - length. Primary standard of length, Interferometry, Gauge blocks, Working instruments.

Base quantities of SI - time. Some historical remarks about calendars and earlier clocks, Primary standard of time, International atomic time (TAI), Coordinated universal time (UTC).
 Electrical quantities. Definition of the ampere, Voltage balance, Josephson effect based voltage standard, Other voltage standards, Standard resistors, Quantum Hall effect based resistance standard.
 Photometry. Radiometry and photometry, Radiometric quantities and their photometric analogues, The present definition of the unit of luminous intensity, primary standards,

Pressure and density measurement. Concepts related to pressure, pressure balance - primary standard, Secondary standards of pressure, Measurement of vacuum.
Hydrostatic weighing, Hydrometers, Pycnometers

Metrology of air humidity and air velocity. Concepts related to air humidity, Primary humidity standards, Secondary humidity standards, Working instruments.
Different types of anemometers, Air-flow meters.

The concept of measurement uncertainty. Measurement error, Corrections, Standard deviation, The concept of measurement uncertainty, Standard uncertainty, type-A evaluated uncertainty, type-B evaluated uncertainty, Probability density functions, Exercises.

Estimation of measurement uncertainty . Mathematical model of measurement, Combining standard uncertainties, Correlations, Expanded uncertainty, Expressing the measurement result, Central limit theorem, Uncertainty budget. Monte-Carlo method and its demonstration, Exercises.
